thread.title: Big honor for Santa Fe attorney
thread.title_full: Big honor for Santa Fe attorney | Albuquerque Journal News

author: Maggie Shepard / Journal Staff Writer
title: Big honor for Santa Fe attorney
text:
Santa Fe attorney Jun Roh has been selected for the prestigious Sandra Day O’Connor Award for Professional
ROH:” I feel totally overwhelmed and surprised.”
Service from the American Inns of Court, given to attorneys rising up the ranks and noted for their ethics, professionalism and willingness to work for those who can’t afford legal representation.
Roh will be presented the award in the U.S. Supreme Court’s oral argument room before Justice Elena Kagan and other attendees at the ceremony Oct. 24 in Washington, D.C.
Roh told the Journal in an interview that he is making sure he gets in lots of practice for his acceptance speech.
“I feel totally overwhelmed and surprised and extremely honored,” Roh said. “I’m thankful for all the attorneys and mentors and colleagues who donate their time for my legal or personal questions, that’s why I feel like I need to give back to the public.”
Roh works in general litigation and represents the state in lawsuits through his firm, Cuddy & McCarthy LLP.
“Only one lawyer a year receives this prestigious award. Lawyers and judges nominate candidates for this award. Then, a national awards committee of the American Inns of Court Foundation selects the honoree from the nominees,” said Eva Jaramillo, executive director of Roh’s firm.
“In the legal community, it is an incredible honor to have a lawyer from New Mexico receive this prominent award.”
Roh has been in New Mexico with the firm since 2007. His mother, from South Korea, lived with him before her death in 2013. His two younger brothers live in South Korea.
Roh said he credits his mother with instilling in him the love of service.
“She would have loved to have seen me in Washington, D.C. I think I will mention her in my speech,” he said.
